column2: IL DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 2. A driver must yield the right of way when making a left turn on a red light after a stop from a one-way street to another one-way street with traffic moving to the left.
3. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 5. If your car goes into water, you should:
column6: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 6. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 7. Illinois law prohibits the use of cannabis for medical purposes.
8. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 9. If a red light fails to turn green after 120 seconds, a motorcycle rider may proceed through the intersection after yielding the right of way to oncoming traffic.
10. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 11. Most signs used in street work areas are:
12. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column6: As close as possible to the center line.

14. This road sign means:
15. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 16. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 17. Bicyclists are prohibited on limited-access highways.
18. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 19. Your driver’s license may be suspended for:
column6: Failure to pass a test following a DUI arrest, revealing a BAC of .08 percent or more.
column8: Giving false information to the Secretary of State.

column2: 20. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 21. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column8: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.

column2: 22. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Not drinking over a period of time.
column8: Eating before or while you drink.

24. Drivers must not turn around on curves and hills unless they can see for at least _______ in all directions.
25. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column8: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column8: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

28. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 29. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 30. Drivers are permitted to wear a headset while driving.

column6: Do not pass on the left.

34. Signs having a red circle with a red slash from the upper-left to the lower-right mean:
column4: No. The picture within the circle shows what is not allowed.
column8: You must yield to oncoming traffic.
